intro: Mandevilla holosericea, commonly known as the pink mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. Mandevilla holosericea prefers full sun to partial shade and well-draining soil for optimal growth.
